snippet.title: Best home video products
snippet.description: We've chosen a cross-section of some of the best home video devices to round out any home theater.

snippet.title: Nokia X Software Platform
snippet.description: Nokia sure tried hard to give us something new, but its mashup of Android, Windows Phone, and Asha gives its Nokia X phone limited powers and a nagging identity crisis.

snippet.title: Facebook Home
snippet.description: Because Facebook Home dominates your Android start screen, it really only makes sense if you're a Facebook junkie. Luckily, you can dial down Facebook Home or completely remove it, even if it comes preloaded on your device.

snippet.title: Software consultant banned by Hilton for snake 'joke'
snippet.description: When filling out online booking forms, joking is tempting. Sometimes, people don't find it funny. Especially if it's a "snake in my trousers" joke.

snippet.title: Revolv Smart Home Solution
snippet.description: Enthusiasts will appreciate Revolv's attempt to bring order to the smart home universe, but those still dabbling with one or two connected devices should wait for this market to expand.

snippet.title: Microsoft Vista Home Basic
snippet.description: Windows Vista Home Basic is essentially warmed-over Windows XP, Windows XP SP3. If you're currently happy with Windows XP SP2, we see no compelling reason to upgrade. On the other hand, if you need a new computer right now, Windows Vista is stable enough for everyday use.

snippet.title: Iris Home Management System
snippet.description: Iris charges $10 per month for full system functionality, making it difficult to recommend over fee-free competitors like SmartThings, iSmartAlarm, or Insteon.

snippet.title: Viper Home
snippet.description: Due to the lower monthly fees, Viper Home is a more intriguing option than Oplink if you want to add accessories like a camera and a siren. If you don't, stick with iSmartAlarm.

snippet.title: SimpliSafe Home Security
snippet.description: Home security options are evolving rapidly, but SimpliSafe is one of our current favorites. If you want a comprehensive, easy-to-use system that features live monitoring, you'll have a hard time finding a better option at a better price.

snippet.title: Peek Calendar
snippet.description: Peek Calendar has a great-looking interface, but too many missing features make it a download worth skipping for now.
